title: How to Make Grilled Pineapple Burgers

steps.headline: Saute the onions under tender or translucent in color.
steps.description: This can be accomplished before or after grilling the burgers.

steps.headline: Make the marinade.
steps.description: Combine the teriyaki sauce and reserved pineapple juice in a small bowl. Add about 2-3 tablespoons of the mixture into a plastic freezer bag and set the remaining aside.

steps.headline: Marinate the pineapple.
steps.description: Add the sliced pineapple to the freezer bag. Carefully cover them with the marinade and set the bag aside.

steps.headline: Make the hamburger patties.
steps.description: Create four patties and season if needed. Add the patties to a square baking dish and drizzle the unused teriyaki marinade over the patties. Turn the patties over, so that both sides are "juiced" evenly.

steps.headline: Grill the burgers and discard any excess marinade.
steps.description: Allow the burgers to cook until well done on both sides (at least 160°F or 71°C).

steps.headline: Grill the pineapple and discard any excess marinade.
steps.description: Allow the pineapple to heat through and remove from the heat. You want the fruit to be juicy, never dried out.

steps.headline: Make the burgers with the following layer order.
steps.description:
Top bun
Lettuce and sauteed onions
Pineapple
Bacon strips
Swiss cheese
Burgers
Bottom bun

text:
Saute the onions under tender or translucent in color. This can be accomplished before or after grilling the burgers. Make the marinade. Combine the teriyaki sauce and reserved pineapple juice in a small bowl. Add about 2-3 tablespoons of the mixture into a plastic freezer bag and set the remaining aside. Marinate the pineapple. Add the sliced pineapple to the freezer bag. Carefully cover them with the marinade and set the bag aside. Make the hamburger patties. Create four patties and season if needed. Add the patties to a square baking dish and drizzle the unused teriyaki marinade over the patties. Turn the patties over, so that both sides are "juiced" evenly. Grill the burgers and discard any excess marinade. Allow the burgers to cook until well done on both sides (at least 160°F or 71°C). Grill the pineapple and discard any excess marinade. Allow the pineapple to heat through and remove from the heat. You want the fruit to be juicy, never dried out. Make the burgers with the following layer order. Top bun
Lettuce and sauteed onions
Pineapple
Bacon strips
Swiss cheese
Burgers
Bottom bun Serve the burgers warm.
